title: Dashboard interface is confusing
content:
The new dashboard layout is really hard to navigate. I can't find the device list anymore, and the search function doesn't work the way it used to.

What I was trying to do: Find all switches in building A
What happened: Got lost in the new interface, took me 10 minutes to find what I needed
What I expected: Quick access to device filtering like before

Please either bring back the old layout or make the new one more intuitive. The current design feels like it was made for developers, not network administrators.
author: Anonymous

form_fields.additional_comments: The new dashboard layout is really hard to navigate...

title: Love the new alert system!
content:
The new alert system is fantastic! The customizable notifications and smart grouping really help me stay on top of network issues without getting overwhelmed.

The mobile push notifications are a game-changer for on-call duties. Being able to acknowledge alerts directly from my phone saves so much time.

One small suggestion: Could you add more granular control over which alerts trigger mobile notifications? I'd love to get notified for critical issues but not for informational alerts.
author: Sarah Chen

metadata.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 17_2 like Mac OS X)

form_fields.additional_comments: The new alert system is fantastic!...

title: Bug report: Export function not working
content:
The CSV export function for device reports is broken. When I click 'Export to CSV', nothing happens. No error message, no download, nothing.

Steps I tried:
1. Go to Device Reports page
2. Apply filters for last 30 days
3. Click 'Export CSV' button
4. Nothing happens

This is blocking our monthly reporting process. We need to export device data for compliance audits.

Browser: Firefox 120.0
OS: Ubuntu 22.04
Console errors: None visible
author: Michael Rodriguez

form_fields.steps_to_reproduce:
1. Go to Device Reports page
2. Apply filters...
3. Click 'Export CSV' button
4. Nothing happens

title: Feature request: Dark mode
content:
Please add a dark mode theme to the dashboard. I work in a NOC environment with low lighting, and the bright white interface causes eye strain after long shifts.

Most modern applications now support dark mode, and it would make PlexNet much more comfortable to use during night shifts.

I would use this feature: Daily
How important is this to you: Very important
Why: Eye strain reduction in low-light environments
author: Jennifer Park

form_fields.additional_details: Work in NOC with low lighting, bright interface causes eye strain

title: Performance issues with 500+ devices
content:
Dashboard performance becomes unacceptable when monitoring more than 500 devices. Page load times exceed 30 seconds, and real-time updates stop working.

Environment:
- Devices monitored: 650
- Dashboard users: 12 concurrent
- Server specs: 16 CPU cores, 64GB RAM
- Network: 10Gbps connection

The performance degradation makes the tool unusable for our network operations center. We need better scalability for enterprise deployments.

Please investigate and optimize for large-scale deployments.
author: David Thompson
